vocabInfos.lsjDefs:
κράσπεδ-ον, τό,
edge, border, skirt, especially of cloth, [Refs 3rd c.BC+]; of the fringe or tassel worn by Jews, [NT+5th c.BC+]
__2 metaphorically, mostly in plural, skirts or edge of a country, [Refs 5th c.BC+]; of a mountain, [Refs 5th c.BC+]; πρὸς κρασπέδοισι στρατοπέδου on the skirts of the army, [Refs 5th c.BC+]: also in singular, Τιμολέοντα ὥσπερ ἐκ κ. τινὸς λεπτοῦ τῆς πολίχνης τῇ Σικελίᾳ προσηρτημένον [Refs 1st c.AD+]
__3 in Medicine texts, affection of the uvula, fimbria, [Refs 2nd c.AD+]
vocabInfos.mediumDef:
edge, border, hem; tassel
a margin, border, edge, in NT a fringe, tuft, tassel, Mt. 9:20; 14:36; 23:5; Mk. 6:56; Lk. 8:44*
